clinical_study.brief_title: Development and Validation of the BVQ
clinical_study.official_title: Development and Validation of the Beliefs About Ventilation Questionnaire (BVQ)

collaborator.agency: Catholic University of the Sacred Heart

brief_summary.textblock: The main aim of this study is the development of the Beliefs about Ventilation Questionnaire (BVQ).

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in adherence NIV in COPD patients at 3, 6 and 12 months as measured by the Beliefs of Ventilation Questionnaire (BVQ)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline + After 3, 6 and 12 months following the recruitment

secondary_outcome.measure: Feasibility and acceptability of the questionnaire (duration / missing data)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline + After 3, 6 and 12 months following the recruitment

secondary_outcome.measure: Reliability over time of the questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline + After 3, 6 and 12 months following the recruitment

secondary_outcome.measure: External construct validity (The World Health Organization Quality of Life (WHOQOL); hours of Non Invasive Ventilation (NIV) prescribed, effective and referred by patients)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline + After 3, 6 and 12 months following the recruitment

study_pop.textblock: People with obstructive or restrictive respiratory diseases

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥ 18 years old
- Indication to Non Invasive Ventilation (NIV), in three slots: <4; >4 e <12; <12 hours
- Outpatients or Inpatients
- Obstructive or restrictive reparatory disorder
- Voluntary agreement to be involved in the Study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Psychiatric Disorder
- Glasgow Coma Scale (CGS) <14
- Pure Obstructive Sleep Apnea Syndrome (OSAS)
- Tracheostomy with Invasive Ventilation (TIV) o Invasive Ventilation (IV)
